intro: Cleistanthus sarawakensis, commonly known as the Sarawak cleistanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, glossy leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually greenish-yellow, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by animals. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
